summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2, 2020, between FBI agents and a British consular official regarding the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire. It details the notification to the UK Consulate, the charges against Maxwell, and her detention status prior to her initial court appearance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She was arrested on July 2, 2020, pursuant to a federal warrant from the SDNY, indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. She is being held by US Marshals in Merrimack County, New Hampshire.

persons.name: Lisa
persons.context: She is the person at the UK Consulate handling the duties of the primary contact who is on maternity leave, following the notification of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: David Tauber
persons.role: Resident Agent in Charge, Diplomatic Security Service
persons.context: He forwarded the notification about Maxwell's arrest to the FBI, requesting the investigating agent contact the British Consulate.

persons.name: Jacqueline Greenlaw
persons.context: She contacted authorities seeking information on Maxwell's detention location and requesting consular access, as formal notification from the FBI had not been received.

persons.name: Phil
persons.context: He is identified as an FBI Supervisory Special Agent based in the Bedford, New Hampshire Resident Agency, involved in the email chain regarding Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Sean G Kirkpatrick
persons.context: He is listed as a recipient in the email chain from Jacqueline Greenlaw regarding the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Greenlaw, as a British Vice Consul, is seeking to provide consular assistance to Maxwell, a British national, following her arrest.
Tauber, as a Resident Agent in Charge with the Diplomatic Security Service, is involved in forwarding the arrest notification of Maxwell to the FBI.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire pursuant to a federal arrest warrant issued by the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

events.title: Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Maxwell was indicted on a six-count indictment including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

events.title: UK Consulate Notification
events.description: The FBI transmitted an arrest notification to the UK Consulate regarding the arrest of British national Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Portsmouth, New Hampshire (Diplomatic Security Service Resident Office)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire on a federal warrant from the SDNY.
She was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts including conspiracy to entice and transport minors, and perjury.
The UK Consulate was formally notified of her arrest as she is a British national, with Vice Consul Jacqueline Greenlaw seeking consular access.
Maxwell was being held by the US Marshals in Merrimack County, New Hampshire, pending her initial court appearance in Concord.
